parents.mother: Françoise Marie (now married to Demenge Valentin of Saulx)

confession.devil_appearance: a tall black man, dressed in black with a dagger on his behind and a black plume on his hat; also appeared as grey-clothed; also in form of a goat with feet raised
confession.seduction_context: At the sabbat at Noirgotte near l'Estraye, where she had been several times as a child with her grandmother Jeannon Garneze

devil_mark.description: caused great pain for two full days

powder_types: little black grains given in a cloth (which she threw away in the fields)
sabbat_locations: high mountain called hault du Jan
sabbat_activities: feasting on black meat without salt and black bread made of ashes
making hail by throwing hair into the air
making butter from milk drawn from the chimney hook
black mass with turnip/radish as host and devil as goat-priest
beating water in fountain with white sticks to make rain and hail
circling wheat fields to destroy crops

witnesses.name: Jean fils feu Chrestofle Heckstein
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: acquaintance from when she brought horses to pasture

witnesses.name: Toussaine femme Arbin Beustal
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor when she was in service of Nicolas Godel

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: Brief summary of voluntary confessions and order for arrest issued at Remiremont by substitut for PG des Vosges

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: First detailed interrogation with extensive confessions about sabbat, devil pact, and accomplices

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: Interrogation at château of Arches; retracted accusations against Remiere Clement, Marie Dany, Royne de la Gotte and her son-in-law Demenge

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for death sentence with confrontation with accused accomplices

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders witnesses to be heard and confronted with her

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: PG des Vosges suggests sufficient evidence to proceed with sentence

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees she is sufficiently convicted as witch and approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: Confrontations with Magdelaine, George, and Mengeotte Bouguinan; given thumbscrews; maintained charges

timeline.subject: Chretienne Parmentier
timeline.details: Executed same day, still persisting in her charges against accomplices

timeline.subject: George Parmentier and Mengeotte Bourgman
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for investigation by prévôt of Arches

accomplices_named.name: Jeannon Garneze
accomplices_named.context: Her grandmother who took her to sabbat as a child

accomplices_named.name: George (son of Jeannon Garneze)
accomplices_named.context: Her uncle who led dancing at sabbat, dressed in cloth with green sword

accomplices_named.name: Magdelaine (daughter of Jeannon Garneze)
accomplices_named.location: Remiremont (married to son of Jean Regnard)
accomplices_named.context: Her aunt, present at sabbat; traveled to sabbat with her on a basket greased with fat

accomplices_named.name: Mongeotte femme Claude Pierre dit Bourginan
le petit Colombain
accomplices_named.context: Went to sabbat with her many times; present with parents

accomplices_named.name: Remiere Clement
accomplices_named.context: Present when Taupin had intercourse with accused; transformed into cat and killed cow with poisoned ball (later retracted)

accomplices_named.name: Marie Dany l'hoste du Thillot
accomplices_named.context: Present when Taupin had intercourse with accused (later retracted, described as 'late' suggesting deceased)

accomplices_named.name: Royne de la Gotte
accomplices_named.context: Made hail at Franois and Travexein, cooked toads at sabbat, made milk from chimney hook (later retracted)

accomplices_named.name: Grand Demenge (son-in-law of Royne de la Gotte)
accomplices_named.context: Made hail, cooked toads, made milk (later retracted)

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Parmentier
notable_quotes.french: Dit que c'est un grand noir homme, qu'elle croit estre le mauvais esprit, habillé de noir ayant un poignard sur le derrier et un pennache noir sur son chapeau.
notable_quotes.english: She said he is a tall black man, whom she believes to be the evil spirit, dressed in black with a dagger on his behind and a black plume on his hat.

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Parmentier
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle renonceast Dieu, la Vierge, parains, maraines et tous ceux qui avoient mis la main a elle, ce qu'elle fit, neanmoins en eust aussy tost repentance
notable_quotes.english: that she renounce God, the Virgin, godparents, godmothers and all those who had laid hands on her, which she did, nevertheless she immediately repented
notable_quotes.context: Describing the renunciation required by Taupin when he marked her

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Parmentier (to Nicolas Godel)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle luy crioit mercy, qu'elle avoit couché dans des buissons
notable_quotes.english: that she cried for his mercy, that she had slept in the bushes
notable_quotes.context: After being found after her night with the devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Parmentier
notable_quotes.french: Au reste qu'elle est grandement marrye d'avoir offensé Dieu comme elle a fait, ne demandant autre chose que de faire ses Pasques et mourir.
notable_quotes.english: Moreover she is greatly sorry to have offended God as she has done, asking nothing else but to take Easter communion and die.
notable_quotes.context: Expressing repentance at end of interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Parmentier
notable_quotes.french: De tous lesquels malheurs et offences elle en a telle douleur et detresse qu'elle n'en peut jecter aucune larme.
notable_quotes.english: For all these misfortunes and offenses she has such pain and distress that she cannot shed any tears.
notable_quotes.context: Describing her emotional state regarding her crimes

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Heckstein (witness 1)
notable_quotes.french: Tellement que par le hantise et frequentise qu'ils eurent par ensemble s'apperceut, qu'elle estoit devenue amoureuse de luy, en sorte qu'elle luy auroit eu achepté des jartieres et luy tesmoigné plusieurs autres signes d'amitie
notable_quotes.english: So that through the association and frequenting they had together he perceived that she had become amorous of him, such that she had bought him garters and shown him several other signs of affection
notable_quotes.context: Witness describing Chretienne's romantic interest in him

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Godel (witness 6)
notable_quotes.french: toute malade et gastée, luy dit que c'estoit une putain et sorciere, qu'elle devenoit d'au diable
notable_quotes.english: all sick and corrupted, told her she was a whore and witch, that she belonged to the devil
notable_quotes.context: Nicolas Godel's reaction when he found her after her night out

relationships.evidence_text: natural daughter of Jean Parmentier of l'Estraye
natural daughter of Jean Parmentier of l'Estraye by Françoise Marie
now married to Demenge Valentin of Saulx
presentement marié a Remiremont au fils de Jean Regnard
Mongeotte femme a Claude Pierre dit Bourginan
le petit Colombain et Chrestienne femme de George Colombain
Had been in his service for 14 months
was bastard daughter of his cousin
Currently living in house of Demenge Fremillot of Fresse

economic_context.details: Chretienne was poor servant who stole beans from garden because she was hungry. She gave devil a 2 sols coin as pledge when he proposed marriage.

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to moictresse of late Nicolas Godel
harms_catalog.harm_description: cow was already sick for 2-3 days, then Remiere Clement transformed into cat and threw poisoned ball into its mouth
harms_catalog.method_alleged: poisoned ball made of dirt from threshold, ashes from behind fireplace stone, and something from where cows are tied; administered by Remiere transformed as cat

harms_catalog.harm_description: circled around wheat fields to make them fail
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Chretienne Parmentier, Royne de la Gotte, Grand Demenge
harms_catalog.method_alleged: beat water in fountain with white sticks given by devil, then circled around wheat in sheaves

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Chretienne Parmentier, Royne de la Gotte, Grand Demenge
harms_catalog.method_alleged: throwing hair into air to make hail

material_culture.context: Chretienne bought garters for Jean Heckstein as sign of affection

Witness gave her bread when she caught her stealing beans
Food at sabbat feast
Food at sabbat feast
Cooked and eaten at sabbat like birds
Used to spear toads before cooking
Rode to sabbat on black horses that carried them like the wind
Grandmother took her to sabbat on a basket greased with fat
Used to grease basket for flying to sabbat
Devil gave her powder in a cloth 5 years ago, but she threw it in fields
Used as host during black mass at sabbat
Gave to devil as pledge when he proposed marriage
Devil promised to buy her this but never did
Uncle George wore this at sabbat
Uncle George wore this at sabbat
Old man played this music at sabbat
Curé of l'Estraye had given her relics but later took them away, after which she had great apprehensions
Devil told her she took too much holy water when entering church
Devil commanded her not to swallow communion host but throw it in river
Drew milk from it like a cow's teat to make butter at sabbat
Turned three times around chimney hook and struck it three times before drawing milk
Devil gave these to beat water in fountain to make rain and hail
Remiere Clement made from dirt, ashes, and other ingredients to kill cow

spatial_references.context: Where Chretienne was living at time of arrest in house of Demenge Fremillot
Where her mother's new husband Demenge Valentin lived
Where order for arrest was issued; where aunt Magdelaine lived
Sabbat location where devil marked her; had been there many times as child
Sabbat location where they made hail and harmed crops
Where they made butter from chimney hook; where they cooked toads
Where Chretienne worked as servant for Nicolas Godel for 14 months; where several witnesses lived

spatial_references.place_name: champs de Champaignes near du Thillot
spatial_references.context: Where devil had intercourse with her
Mountain pasture where witness Jean Heckstein lived; where Chretienne brought horses
Where Chrestienne Colombain was executed; where château was located for later interrogations
Where devil appeared to her and told her she took too much holy water
Where she threw communion host into river on devil's command

spatial_references.place_name: clos Brice Mansuyt behind house of Danys l'hoste
spatial_references.context: Where she was found after her night out; ground was beaten as if danced upon

weather_events: hail made by witches at sabbat
rain made by beating water with white sticks
economic_hardship_indicators: Chretienne stole beans because she was hungry

prior_legal_disputes.description: Stole beans from garden of Simon Claude Anthoine
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Given bread and told not to steal again

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Interrogations held at house of Nicolas Laurent at Le Thillot, then moved to château of Arches

hearsay_chains.content: she had confessed to her master that she was a witch
Had long heard that she was a witch; told other children she was a witch

emotional_state_notes: greatly sorry to have offended God
asked only to take Easter communion and die
had such pain and distress that she could not shed any tears
became 'troublé de son esprit' (troubled in spirit) regarding romantic rejection

third_parties.context: Chretienne was living in his house in Fresse at time of arrest

third_parties.context: His clos (field) was near where Chretienne spent the night with devil

third_parties.name: Danys l'hoste

third_parties.name: Sr Curé de l'Estraye
third_parties.context: Had given Chretienne relics but later took them away, after which she had great apprehensions and went to sabbat

prior_accusations.context: Remy Demenge Parmentier testified he had long heard she was a witch; she was supposed to have been corrupted by her grandmother and taken to sabbat; told other children she was a witch when guarding animals
Told her husband that Chretienne had confessed to Nicolas Godel that she was a witch

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally rich trial record with detailed confessions, subsequent retractions, and witness testimony. Key features: (1) Voluntary initial confession followed by detailed interrogations; (2) Extensive sabbat confessions including locations, attendees, activities; (3) Partial retraction on July 1, 1624 where she discharged several accomplices (Remiere Clement, Marie Dany, Royne de la Gotte, Grand Demenge) but maintained charges against family members; (4) Torture with thumbscrews before execution; (5) Maintained charges until death; (6) Romantic rejection by Jean Heckstein may have contributed to psychological distress; (7) Removal of protective relics by priest preceded her confessions; (8) Investigation of named accomplices ordered after execution. The case shows pattern of family-based accusation networks and psychological vulnerability.
